poem:
Title: "Man's Pursuit of Extraterrestrial Grace"

Launched into the yawning void,
The crafted bird, by human hand assembled,
Sings its metallic song.
Echoes of past triumphs haunt the journey,
Yet an unseen hand plays upon the strings of progress,
Tangling the cosmic dance into fresh complexity.
"Yee-haw!" cries man, yet the moon remains unmoved,
Her silence speaking of simplicities forgotten.
